line.comment: * Task 202.
* For performance purposes, we avoid starting every cycle at the exact same time.
* Zero Hour 1.6
* Mordan2
* Performance purposes.
* MordanA - Major shipyards do a lot of everything better.
* Mordan2
* just for debugging
* Reset all the Jump station perks. For debugging purposes.
* Fixed a rare bug where the sector could be Unknown.
* Mordan2
* hotfix. strip color, or it will append the color over and over to the station name.
* If station was renamed, and had been colored at some point, you will lose your color. This will auto-restore it.
* display subtitle text: text='Restored Station name Color' duration=3000 ms
* MordanA
* Since the player can re-homebase one of these fighters in order to gain control of it, we have to use something other than their homebase to track which system they should be defending.
* So basically, we iterate through all player owned fighters looking for whichever ones are 'tagged' with this station. That is the system they must defend.
* If ship has this outpost as it's tag
* The player has moved this ship or done something to cause it to relocate. destroy it.

line.text: ' и был уничтожен. Видимо, он сбился с курса.'

line.comment: * Mordan9 reworked logic here. Go in for repairs if we get below 1/2 hull, but don't restart defend routine until we are over 90%.
* Low Hull. Stop any defense script running
* If not at homebase already, go there and repair
* 50%-90% Still repairing if docked up, otherwise just ensure we are defending.
* Init station fighter count. Each station has a value of 2-4 support fighters, with the upper number in the 9973 config file. Only relevant when the perk is active.
* Now determine when the last fighter was created so we can stagger them. Also, the highter population of a system, the more rapidly they are created/replaced.
* if not enough time has elaped, just stop here.
* For 100 people in the station, it will require 20 minutes to acquire a new ship. The more people, the less time it will take.
* Create a new system support fighter
* Herobetty: if player joined the OCV, Xenon and OCV ships will be support fighters instead.
* Add-Ons 1.2: Removed OCV ships from pool.
* NOTE: because Xenon and OCV don't have a template (doing so means they'd have a battle group, etc.), separate logic is done for their ships.
* Standard
* Better
* M4 class
* end if perk enabled.
* end Mordan
* 25 default
* Define the time when the event will trigger, and the type of the event.
* Mordan8 - For HARD and INSANE difficulty, we only give a 85% reduction in the chance an event will occur at the outpost.
* not on hard or insane difficulty, so no event occurs with this perk.
* Hard and insane difficulty - 85% chance to avoid the event with this perk.
* Add-Ons 1.3: Fixed off-by-1 error (was an 84% chance instead).
* Start the event if it's planned.
* Manage current event.
* This is the only event that is managed here.
* End of the event.
* Herobetty 5.3: repair+ (enhanced version of repair) also gives +100% repair rate.
* MordanA - Major shipyards repair 20% faster.
* Check if we can produce anything.
* Get variables.
* ZH 2.0 - all player Outposts can generate tax without the perk
* skip if [THIS]-> call script 'Mayhem.IsPerkUnlocked' : perk='Tax'
* endsub
* Add-Ons 1.2: Major shipyard logic now handled inside solar panels script.
* Herobetty 5.2: Due to faster research perk being multiplicative as of 5.0, it is now a multiplicative bonus instead of additive for both hacking and cyberwar.
* Herobetty 4.6: The cycle has a default time of 20 minutes (1200 seconds). However, a research rate of 100 will instead result in a cycle of 18 minutes.
* Changing the numerator scale factor to 100 (was 3*30 = 90) results in having 20 minutes at 100% research rate. 100% research rate is considered standard.
* Old calculation: $cycle = ($cycle * 3) * 30 / $researchRate
* New: $cycle = ($cycle * 100) / $researchRate
* generate Hackerchips
* Mordan8 changed so it now generates 5 chips instead of 1.
* select a sector, scan ports of all ships inside, install possible backdoors
* ZH 2.0 - now working for all ship types
* skip if $ship-> is of class [Huge Ship]
* continue
* do if $system == 1 OR $system == 5
* no automatic stealing money or bailing ships
* continue
* skip if [THIS]-> call script 'Mayhem.IsPerkUnlocked' : perk='Space Weed manufacture'
* endsub
* MordanA
* Add-Ons 1.2: Moved to new script.
* Phanon Outposts never produce food
* ZH 2.0 - no more food production after player joins OCV
* Add-Ons 1.2: Legendary effects. Base values are actually 0, but their bonus values are: 40 tela/min, 25 rastar/min, 60 ore/min, 60 silicon/min
* Handle legendary effects here.
* Phanon Outposts never consume food
* ZH 2.0 - no more food consumption after player joins OCV
* The AI consumes food, but does not risk starvation.
* Growth.
* growth is now limited directly in Mayhem.GetNaturalGrowth to never overshoot max pop, because arriving Refugees can exceed max pop.
* do if $people > $maxPeople
* $people = $maxPeople
* Not every people die at once!
* START [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.Infobox' : text=$t icon=null timeout=null fadeout=null
* Mordan8 - doubled number of diseased people for this event.
* MordanC
* Add-Ons 1.2: Fixed cycle time (was 1 minute!) and added partial fill.
* 5 pops every 10 minutes (default cycle time).
* How much room is left?
* If no room at all, shut down.
* 33% chance that one of them won't make it. Hijacked, died in transit, got spaced because they were a dick.. Who knows. Stuff happens.
* Clamp arrivals so that we don't exceed destination capacity.
* Source always loses 5 people. Extra people died in transit.
* * DEBUG STATEMENTS **
* write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Dest %s new Population=%s', $transferringPopTo, $newDestTotal, null, null, null
* write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Source %s new Population=%s', [THIS], $newSourceTotal, null, null, null
* Destination disappeared (destroyed/removed). Stop transferring.
* Loop.
* Invalid missiles (3.8).
* Zero Hour 1.8
* ZH 2.0 - garbage quality didnt work
* Reserve management. Note that AI recycles all equipment before putting the ship in reserve (Mayhem.Task.SellYourselfFrom).
* Also note that the AI will still have to pay time to build ships from reserve (should have no impact on gameplay).
* ZH 2.0 - terraforming limits local player outpost + all phanon outposts to crafting at snails pace

* Add-Ons 1.1: No longer limits Phanon. However, terraforming limits local player outpost by 0.5x per project (e.g., 3 projects = 0.125x), stacked with global penalty and rounded up. Penalties have 2 decimal places, so 0 to 10000 = 0 to 100%.

* Overflow if we do all the multiplication at once. Need to convert the stacked penalties into percentage (no decimal points) ranging from 0 to 100%. Then, convert that percentage to a decimal and multiply with the building progress factor accordingly.
* * DEBUG **
* $numerator = ($buildingProgressFactor * ($penalty.local * $penalty.global + 5000))
* $t = 'penalty local: ' + $penalty.local + '; penalty global: ' + $penalty.global + '; building progress factor: ' + $buildingProgressFactor + '; numerator: ' + $scaleFactor
* write to player logbook $t
* Add-Ons 1.4.14: Phanon limit is back but only on insane mode and while allied with the player. It is 0.7x as much.
* If the player has infamy, then Phanon suffers a 0.9x multiplier, stacking with the insane mode penalty.
* Add object(s).
* Ship.
* Ship or station.
* Zero Hour 1.10
* See Mayhem.Squadron.GetBuildingOutposts.
* Laser, missile, shield and station.
* Increase base specialization level.
* every hour = 3600 seconds
* For each neighbor,
* If owned by another major race and not at war with them
* improve relations a bit, up to 0. (neutral)
* if improving to neutral, give a message.
* what is the penalty for putting down an outpost next to someone? that amount should be repaired over the course of a day.
* skip this outpost
* skip any outposts we own ourselves.

* Only perk races in this array. Ensures we only perk 1 time for a neighboring race even if there are multiple outposts present for that race. see below where we remove element to avoid processing a race twice.
* remove this race from the commonwealth array so we don't perk this race again in this loop.
* You can't improve rep with faction past Neutral using this perk.
* are we at war?
* are we at permanent war with this race. If so, the perk won't help. Probably irrelevant call, but we'll make it anyway.
* Set/check a global here, indicating the last reputation with this faction. If it has lowered, it means the player is continuing to harass the faction.
* if current reputation has gone down, they have been bad.
* Amount to repair every 24 hours Mordan3 adjust.
* save rep to lastReputation global here, which is race specific

sval.val: и был уничтожен. Видимо, он сбился с курса.
Обстановка на вашем Форпосте в секторе
For performance purposes, we avoid starting every cycle at the exact same time.
MordanA - Major shipyards do a lot of everything better.
Reset all the Jump station perks. For debugging purposes.
Fixed a rare bug where the sector could be Unknown.
hotfix. strip color, or it will append the color over and over to the station name.
If station was renamed, and had been colored at some point, you will lose your color. This will auto-restore it.
display subtitle text: text='Restored Station name Color' duration=3000 ms
Since the player can re-homebase one of these fighters in order to gain control of it, we have to use something other than their homebase to track which system they should be defending.
So basically, we iterate through all player owned fighters looking for whichever ones are 'tagged' with this station. That is the system they must defend.
If ship has this outpost as it's tag
The player has moved this ship or done something to cause it to relocate. destroy it.
Mordan9 reworked logic here. Go in for repairs if we get below 1/2 hull, but don't restart defend routine until we are over 90%.
Low Hull. Stop any defense script running
If not at homebase already, go there and repair
50%-90% Still repairing if docked up, otherwise just ensure we are defending.
Init station fighter count. Each station has a value of 2-4 support fighters, with the upper number in the 9973 config file. Only relevant when the perk is active.
Now determine when the last fighter was created so we can stagger them. Also, the highter population of a system, the more rapidly they are created/replaced.
if not enough time has elaped, just stop here.
For 100 people in the station, it will require 20 minutes to acquire a new ship. The more people, the less time it will take.
Create a new system support fighter
Herobetty: if player joined the OCV, Xenon and OCV ships will be support fighters instead.
Add-Ons 1.2: Removed OCV ships from pool.
NOTE: because Xenon and OCV don't have a template (doing so means they'd have a battle group, etc.), separate logic is done for their ships.
Define the time when the event will trigger, and the type of the event.
Mordan8 - For HARD and INSANE difficulty, we only give a 85% reduction in the chance an event will occur at the outpost.
not on hard or insane difficulty, so no event occurs with this perk.
Hard and insane difficulty - 85% chance to avoid the event with this perk.
Add-Ons 1.3: Fixed off-by-1 error (was an 84% chance instead).
Start the event if it's planned.
This is the only event that is managed here.
Herobetty 5.3: repair+ (enhanced version of repair) also gives +100% repair rate.
Check if we can produce anything.
ZH 2.0 - all player Outposts can generate tax without the perk
Add-Ons 1.2: Major shipyard logic now handled inside solar panels script.
Herobetty 5.2: Due to faster research perk being multiplicative as of 5.0, it is now a multiplicative bonus instead of additive for both hacking and cyberwar.
Herobetty 4.6: The cycle has a default time of 20 minutes (1200 seconds). However, a research rate of 100 will instead result in a cycle of 18 minutes.
Changing the numerator scale factor to 100 (was 3*30 = 90) results in having 20 minutes at 100% research rate. 100% research rate is considered standard.
Mordan8 changed so it now generates 5 chips instead of 1.
select a sector, scan ports of all ships inside, install possible backdoors
ZH 2.0 - now working for all ship types
skip if $ship-> is of class [Huge Ship]
no automatic stealing money or bailing ships
skip if [THIS]-> call script 'Mayhem.IsPerkUnlocked' : perk='Space Weed manufacture'
ZH 2.0 - no more food production after player joins OCV
Add-Ons 1.2: Legendary effects. Base values are actually 0, but their bonus values are: 40 tela/min, 25 rastar/min, 60 ore/min, 60 silicon/min
ZH 2.0 - no more food consumption after player joins OCV
The AI consumes food, but does not risk starvation.
growth is now limited directly in Mayhem.GetNaturalGrowth to never overshoot max pop, because arriving Refugees can exceed max pop.
Not every people die at once!
START [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.Infobox' : text=$t icon=null timeout=null fadeout=null
Mordan8 - doubled number of diseased people for this event.
Add-Ons 1.2: Fixed cycle time (was 1 minute!) and added partial fill.
If no room at all, shut down.
33% chance that one of them won't make it. Hijacked, died in transit, got spaced because they were a dick.. Who knows. Stuff happens.
Clamp arrivals so that we don't exceed destination capacity.
Source always loses 5 people. Extra people died in transit.
write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Dest %s new Population=%s', $transferringPopTo, $newDestTotal, null, null, null
write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Source %s new Population=%s', [THIS], $newSourceTotal, null, null, null
Reserve management. Note that AI recycles all equipment before putting the ship in reserve (Mayhem.Task.SellYourselfFrom).
Also note that the AI will still have to pay time to build ships from reserve (should have no impact on gameplay).
ZH 2.0 - terraforming limits local player outpost + all phanon outposts to crafting at snails pace

Add-Ons 1.1: No longer limits Phanon. However, terraforming limits local player outpost by 0.5x per project (e.g., 3 projects = 0.125x), stacked with global penalty and rounded up. Penalties have 2 decimal places, so 0 to 10000 = 0 to 100%.

Overflow if we do all the multiplication at once. Need to convert the stacked penalties into percentage (no decimal points) ranging from 0 to 100%. Then, convert that percentage to a decimal and multiply with the building progress factor accordingly.
$t = 'penalty local: ' + $penalty.local + '; penalty global: ' + $penalty.global + '; building progress factor: ' + $buildingProgressFactor + '; numerator: ' + $scaleFactor
Add-Ons 1.4.14: Phanon limit is back but only on insane mode and while allied with the player. It is 0.7x as much.
If the player has infamy, then Phanon suffers a 0.9x multiplier, stacking with the insane mode penalty.
If owned by another major race and not at war with them
improve relations a bit, up to 0. (neutral)
if improving to neutral, give a message.
what is the penalty for putting down an outpost next to someone? that amount should be repaired over the course of a day.
skip any outposts we own ourselves.

Only perk races in this array. Ensures we only perk 1 time for a neighboring race even if there are multiple outposts present for that race. see below where we remove element to avoid processing a race twice.
remove this race from the commonwealth array so we don't perk this race again in this loop.
You can't improve rep with faction past Neutral using this perk.
are we at permanent war with this race. If so, the perk won't help. Probably irrelevant call, but we'll make it anyway.
Set/check a global here, indicating the last reputation with this faction. If it has lowered, it means the player is continuing to harass the faction.
if current reputation has gone down, they have been bad.
Amount to repair every 24 hours Mordan3 adjust.
save rep to lastReputation global here, which is race specific
